es.upc.fib.prop.shared13

Class Graph

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.upc.fib.prop.shared13.Graph
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Congress, LGraph, TGraph

    public abstract class Graph
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract graph class representing undirected weighted graphs. Created mainly by Albert Segarra with some contributions by Miquel Jubert. Notes: 1: A node n is said to belong/be/etc. to a graph/edge if there exists an edge n' such that n.equals(n') and n' belongs to the graph/edge 2: An edge instance e is said to be valid if a call to e.isValid() returns true 3: The Collections returned by some of the class operations are meant to be used for iterating through its elements or getting to know their size. Using operations like contains is not recommended, as its cost is linear.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Graph()
      Creates an empty Graph

      Adds a node to the graph in case it didn't already belong to it.
      java.util.Collection<Edge> getAdjacencyList(Node n)
      Returns a non-modifiable collection with the graph edges having n as one of its nodes, i.e the adjacency list of n.

      Returns an edge given by two nodes belonging to the graph.

      Returns the degree i.e number of adjacent nodes to a given node of the graph.

      boolean removeNode(Node n)
      Removes a given node n' from the graph if it belonged to the graph and returns whether it belonged (i.e whether the graph has been modified by the call).

      • getAdjacencyList

        public java.util.Collection<Edge> getAdjacencyList(Node n)
        Returns a non-modifiable collection with the graph edges having n as one of its nodes, i.e the adjacency list of n.
        Parameters:
        n - the node whose adjacency list is requested.
        Returns:
        a non-modifiable collection with the adjacency list of the node n' such that n' belongs to the graph and n.equals(n').
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the node n doesn't belong to the graph.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the node n is null.

        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the node n is null.

      • hasNode

        public boolean hasNode(Node n)
        Returns whether the node n belongs to the graph.
        Parameters:
        n - the node to test for belonging to the graph.
        Returns:
        true if there exists a node n' such that it belongs to the graph and n.equals(n').
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if n is null

      • getNodeDegree

        public int getNodeDegree(Node n)
        Returns the degree i.e number of adjacent nodes to a given node of the graph.
        Parameters:
        n - the node from which to get the degree.
        Returns:
        the degree of the node n' such that n' belongs to the graph and n.equals(n').
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if n is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the node n doesn't belong to the graph.

      • getValidNodeDegree

        public int getValidNodeDegree(Node n)
        Returns the valid degree i.e number of nodes connected by a valid edge to a given node of the graph.
        Parameters:
        n - the node from which to get the degree.
        Returns:
        the valid degree of the node n' such that n' belongs to the graph and n.equals(n').
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if n is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the node n doesn't belong to the graph.

      • hasEdge

        public boolean hasEdge(Node n1,
              Node n2)
        Returns whether the graph contains a given edge formed by two nodes belonging to the graph.
        Parameters:
        n1 - The pair of nodes of the edge to test for belonging.
        Returns:
        true if there exists an edge e in the graph such that it contains the two given nodes (no matter the order in which they're given).
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if n1 is null or n2 is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either n1 or n2 don't belong to the graph.

      • hasValidEdge

        public boolean hasValidEdge(Node n1,
                   Node n2)
        Returns whether the graph contains a given valid edge formed by two nodes belonging to the graph.
        Parameters:
        n1 - The pair of nodes of the valid edge to test for belonging.
        Returns:
        true if there exists a valid edge e in the graph such that it contains the two given nodes (no matter the order in which they're given).
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if n1 is null or n2 is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either n1 or n2 don't belong to the graph.

      • getEdge

        public Edge getEdge(Node n1,
           Node n2)
        Returns an edge given by two nodes belonging to the graph. Note that all modifications made to the returned edge will affect the edge contained in the graph
        Parameters:
        n1 - one of the nodes of the edge.
        n2 - the other node of the edge.
        Returns:
        the edge which contains n1 and n2 as its nodes (no matter the order in which they're given) or null if the edge doesn't exist.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if n1 is null or n2 is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either n1 or n2 don't belong to the graph

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the graph. First the Graph order and number of edges are printed, followed by the list of nodes of the graph, followed by the list of edges of the graph. The string ends with a new line.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of the graph.

      • addNode

        public boolean addNode(Node n)
        Adds a node to the graph in case it didn't already belong to it. The return value indicates whether it didn't already belong to the graph.
        Parameters:
        n - the node to add to the graph.
        Returns:
        true if the node n didn't already belong to the graph.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if n is null.

      • removeAllNodeEdges

        public void removeAllNodeEdges(Node n)
        Removes all the edges in the graph having n as one of its nodes.
        Parameters:
        n - the node whose edges need to be removed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if n is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if n doesn't belong to the graph

      • removeNode

        public boolean removeNode(Node n)
        Removes a given node n' from the graph if it belonged to the graph and returns whether it belonged (i.e whether the graph has been modified by the call).
        Parameters:
        n - the node to remove from the graph.
        Returns:
        true if the node belonged to the graph before the removal try.

      • addEdge

        public boolean addEdge(Edge e)
        Adds a given edge to the graph and returns whether it didn't already belong to the graph before the call. Note that the graph will not be modified if the edge already belongs to the graph, i.e there is an edge e' such that e' belongs to the graph and e.equals(e')
        Parameters:
        e - The edge to add to the graph
        Returns:
        true if the edge didn't belong to the graph before the call
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if e is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one or both nodes of the edge don't belong to the graph

      • removeEdge

        public boolean removeEdge(Node n1,
                 Node n2)
        Removes an edge identified by two nodes n1, n2 from the graph and returns whether the edge was in the graph before the call. The edge to be removed is such that it belongs to the graph and it contains the nodes n1 and n2 (no matter the order in which they're given).
        Parameters:
        n1 - One of the nodes of the edge to remove
        n2 - The other node of the edge to remove
        Returns:
        true if the edge belonged to the graph before the removal try.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if n1 is null or n2 is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one or both nodes of the edge don't belong to the graph.

      • invalidateAllEdges

        public void invalidateAllEdges()
        Invalidates all edges in the graph
